body_html: Even GitHub itself had 98.7% availability, back when I helped rewrite Bazel's downloader. If we start adding additional mirrors (e.g. AWS, Alibaba, etc.) then I'd ideally like to see it be systemic, i.e. more than just nasm. That would elevate Bazel to carrier grade status.
body_text: Even GitHub itself had 98.7% availability, back when I helped rewrite Bazel's downloader. If we start adding additional mirrors (e.g. AWS, Alibaba, etc.) then I'd ideally like to see it be systemic, i.e. more than just nasm. That would elevate Bazel to carrier grade status.
body: Even GitHub itself had 98.7% availability, back when I helped rewrite [Bazel's downloader](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/ed7ced0018dc5c5ebd6fc8afc7158037ac1df00d). If we start adding additional mirrors (e.g. AWS, Alibaba, etc.) then I'd ideally like to see it be systemic, i.e. more than just nasm. That would elevate Bazel to carrier grade status.
